result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex Romel Gathing-Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Alex Romel Gathing-Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Alex Romel Gathing-Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Alex Romel Gathing-Brown appeared by video.  Attorney Ruby De Leon appeared by video for Alex Romel Gathing-Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and parties are still negotiating. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alex Romel Gathing-Brown in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Defense counsel requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel, received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with ER (dob 9/4/99)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Alex Romel Gathing-Brown in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Alex Romel Gathing-Brown in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alex Romel Gathing-Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
